title: Screen Resolution problem only after patch 7.1
body:
My monitor is 1360/768. I've been playing on this resolution since season 3 . I entered a game today and it was saying ' No optimum mode,Recomanded : 1360/768' I've left the game,went to config and changed it to 800/600;nothing happened. Then changed it to 1024/768;nothing happened,then changed it on 1360/768;nothing happened. I even changed the resolution on my 'screen resolution' on desktop to all kinds of resolutions,nothing happened,same thing was happening. Then i joined the game,pressed alt+enter,thing which led me to windowed mode,i could see the game. Pressed restore to defaults,then fullscreen mode;same thing was happing. Pressed alt enter again and choose 1360/768 and after that 1024/768(which is the lowest resolution there is) but it still didn't work. I really wanna hear a fix for this because that is not in my power,this patch did it,and i'll probably get a low priority queue because of that.

Thanks.

forgot to mention: i've tried to play on both clients,the new one and the legacy one,still not working.

replies.body: Some players are currently experiencing issues in full screen, and updates are being provided on the [service status](http://status.leagueoflegends.com/#na) page.  I don't have any updates to share on a more permanent fix, but alt+enter is the current workaround.  Hang tight!
So i should get the low priority queue because of your mistake,right ? That's how you do things,ty.

The way to make it work for about a week:
Get another monitor(an old one if you have one) and plug it and start a game. From there you can change back to your old monitor and play for about a week before this happens again. The problem is after that week is over you gotta get a new monitor since the old one won't fix the problem again idk why bb jesus let me play lol{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 


I love how riot refuses to concentrate on fixing this problem which stops many players from playing.
I now have about 20 low priority games because of this problem.
